abstract: Study published in journal PLoS One finds that people judge other people's race using larger cues than just skin color and facial features, including the clothing they wear.
snippet: A new study suggests that our perception of race is altered by the clothing people wear.
lead_paragraph: A new study suggests that our perception of race is altered by the clothing people wear.

headline.main: Is Race Reflected by Your Outfit?
headline.print_headline: Is Race Reflected By Your Outfit?
headline.seo: When Color Is Reflected in a Janitor’s Outfit - Studied
